TopicTitle: What new parts would people be interested in seeing?

Articles.Content:
I'm interested in seeing what the community wants parts-wise. Considering KSP has broken into full release, it could really go anywhere from here. Would you be interested in seeing station parts? Or more capsules? Perhaps 5 metre rockets for those crazy buggers who want to do single launches.

Personally, I would like larger and more diverse capsules, specifically a 3.75m Command Service Module and associated parts such as crew container, science lab, monoprop tank, reaction wheel, yada yada. Also, monopropellant based orbiter engines with associated tanks would be pretty cool.

I'll start wanting 5 meter super-engines as soon as we start getting 5 meter super-tanks and other parts. For now though, we should fill out the 3.75 meter category with some large station parts, e.g. Science labs.
I really want a Gemini style 1.25m command pod.

Station and colony parts please, though maybe they could be part of a future colonisation paid expansion?

also new parts for big interplanetary motherships - more nuclear engines, non-aircraft liquid fuel tanks, spinning toridal crew modules etc...
I'd like to see hinges so we could fold and unfold things. Maybe not at the level of Infernal Robotics, but at least something. It's a shame we have fairings but nothing to store folded in them.
Space Shuttle Engines! We have the perfect parts, except them. I know it's possible to do it without, but it would be damn cool and make space shuttles really viable (especially for new-ish people)

DEFINITELY need 2.5m and 3.75m variants of the RAPIER engine so we wouldn't need a ridiculous amount of 1.25m RAPIER engines to get a Mk3 spaceplane in to orbit.

also, 2.5m and 3.75m solid boosters would be nice too, so we won't need a ridiculous amount of large boosters wrapped around our large fuel tanks; just pop a 2.5m or 3.75m stubby on the bottom and away it goes.

This ^^ the lack of a two-kerbal capsule is a major omission, it's much needed in the early career game when engineers and scientists need a pilot to get into orbit for training and for those rescue missions. At the moment I cobble a couple of Mk 1 capsules together. It works but it's so inelegant.

I first thought another 1.25m capsule would be pointless, but you totally convinced me here.

Only thing : How would you fit 2 kerbals inside a 1.25m capsule ? the one we already have is relatively big already and only seats one.

> 
> Only thing : How would you fit 2 kerbals inside a 1.25m capsule ? the one we already have is relatively big already and only seats one.

I'm sure Valentina wouldn't mind sitting in Jeb's lap, facing backwards. \*wink, wink\*
Advanced nuclear engines. Maybe 3.75 parts that are big and heavy and can't be launched by anything but a monster rocket but once they are in orbit get 1200 ISP and have the trust of a mainsail.
Also would really like to see an early-tech-tree two-man 1.25, command pod, as others have described.

Some aerospike engines. No, that thing we currently have isn't an aerospike engine, it's a plug nozzle engine. An aerospike is a plug nozzle engine with almost all of the spike removed - instead, gases from the turbopumps are used to create the 'spike' against which the main exhaust pushes. Ideally, I'd like a 1.25, 2.5 and 3.75m circular aerospike engines, and perhaps a 1.25m linear aerospike (in this case, the engine is rectangular, and the 'spike' is a ridge) for the spaceplane enthusiasts. I've tried emulating this [http://www.astronautix.com/lvs/pegvtovl.htm](http://www.astronautix.com/lvs/pegvtovl.htm) using lots of tiny radial engines and a bigorange fuelk tank, but it didn't work well :-(

Also, more science is ALWAYS good!

Right now what can you do on EVA? 

-repair a few select things that can be broken

-walk/move around

-plant flag

-suface sample(In-game animation please)

-EVA report

-move data

nothing really keeps you on the surface for more than a minute.

So to improve that experience, I want to do this stuff on EVA. **Deployable science experiments**: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Lunar_Surface_Experiments_Package#Deployment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Lunar_Surface_Experiments_Package#Deployment)

there are a few different experiments you can include ingame inside a 'Surface Experiment Package' : [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Lunar_Surface_Experiments_Package#List_of_experiments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Lunar_Surface_Experiments_Package#List_of_experiments)

theres a mod for this yadda-yadda whatever. It should be a stock feature.

Well, the Soviets did manage to cram three cosmonauts into a Vostok capsule.

More jet engines, different levels of power and use in the atmosphere, 5 would be ideal.

More rocket engines on all levels of the tech tree, (fuel efficiency/TWR would be the main differences other than looks) 

More liquid fuel and LFO tanks of all kinds.

More capsule variations for rockets and planes.

More rover wheels for all parts of the tech tree, i want to see stronger wheels with suspension, tracks, hover gear things like that. 

More structural parts, specifically round ones

Wings im actually fairly happy with. 

Basically more of everything thats already in the game.
i would like to see a rover bay with ramp, something that can be used inline, that scales all the way up to 5m for larger stuff

Bigger parts for standardised designs, for sure. And more capsules.

Folding radiators are a MUST for the rebalanced LV-Ns.

Telescopic booms. New aero means you can't just launch big wide things, so they've gotta fold.

Bigger fricken' ladders. Maybe ones where you can just select the length you want them to extend to?

Nuclear reactors. Heavy, but generate lots of power for outer-system missions without consuming vital mission fuel like fuel cells do.

Moar experiments. More science. More stuff to unlock with the science gained. More reason to visit things other than 'it's there', so I don't just put off going past Duna.
I want more station/base parts, because i like how the lab and the mining bring strategy elements to the game. I want a reason for extending my stations/bases.

This belongs in Suggestions and Development Discussion, moving.

I really, really want a 2.5m LF tank with a good mass ratio.

More base parts and equipment parts.

And KAS features and parts.

Landing gear with adjustable height.

Keeping ground clearance can be quite difficult at times.. I'd rather not have to be building extended structures just to put my wheels in the right spot - that's the entire *point* of landing gear. It's annoying that we don't have the ability to use longer or shorter sets as needed.
